summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on November 29, 2021, regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It encourages colleagues to attend the trial opening, expresses the office's commitment to prosecuting historic sex crimes, and outlines logistical details for courtroom access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

events.title: Trial Opening for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The email announces the opening of the trial, with peremptory challenges starting at 8:30 a.m., followed by preliminary instructions and opening statements. It encourages attendance and provides courtroom details.

keyFacts: The document is a prosecutorial communication expressing a strong commitment to holding Ghislaine Maxwell accountable for historic sex crimes.

It contrasts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute old cases with an implied criticism of prosecutors elsewhere (specifically mentioned: Florida) who might be 'afraid' to do so.
It states the core allegation of the trial: that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.
It provides specific logistical details for the trial's opening day, including multiple overflow courtrooms and a dedicated feed for the office.
The email frames the upcoming trial as a pursuit of justice where 'brave women will take the witness stand' and the truth will come out.
